personal.name: Kavish Shah
personal.title: Computer Science Student & Software Engineer
personal.bio:
Hey ðŸ‘‹
I'm Kavish, a Computer Science Honors student at Arizona State University's Barrett Honors College with a 3.84 GPA. I specialize in building scalable full-stack applications and AI/ML systems. I've worked at FarmX Inc. developing AI-powered soil moisture prediction models with 96% accuracy, and at Dark Alpha Capital creating RAG chatbots that improved accuracy by 40%. I'm passionate about leveraging AI, machine learning, and full-stack development to solve real-world problems.

current.degree: Bachelor of Science Honors in Computer Science
current.institution: Arizona State University - Barrett, The Honors College

achievements: Barrett Honors College Scholar with 3.84 GPA
Treasurer at SoDA (The Software Developer Association)
Barrett Residential Peer Mentor mentoring 50+ students
Member of Data Science Club, Code Devils, and Pickleball Club

experience.description: Achieved 96% predictive accuracy in soil moisture estimation through developing an AI-powered pipeline leveraging Random Forest and Gradient Boosting, improving irrigation efficiency across diverse soil types. Reduced irrigation error variance by 40% by implementing soil-texture-specific calibration models. Accomplished competitive accuracy within 5% of ensemble models by implementing Linear Regression, reducing training complexity and computation time by 60%.

Developed and deployed scalable full-stack web applications using Next.js, Prisma, and PostgreSQL, reducing manual deal tracking efforts by 25%. Deployed a RAG chatbot implementing persistent long-term memory, reducing internal deal tracking time by 30% and improving multi-turn accuracy by 40%. Resolved critical memory persistence issues in multi-session AI workflows, increasing chatbot context retention by 80% and reducing duplicate query errors by over 50%.

experience.company: Ira A. Fulton Schools of Engineering
experience.description: Directed a team of peers to develop an interactive workshop series for new engineering students, enhancing engagement by over 40 participants per event. Collaborated with a team of 17 students to organize workshops for over 2000 first-year students. Mentored 50+ first-year engineering students through weekly check-ins, resulting in a 30% increase in student engagement and retention.

projects.title: GreenStream AI
projects.description: Developed an AI-powered chatbot using FastAPI and Anthropic Claude models to deliver industry-specific analyses and citations from public data, reducing user research time by 50%. Implemented real-time query handling and dynamic data visualization in React/Next.js, improving response latency by 35% and enhancing user engagement by 30%.

projects.title: Code Sentinel Bot
projects.description: Reduced pull request review time by 30% and boosted developer productivity by 25% by creating an automated code review bot with GitHub Actions and OpenAI GPT models using GitHub API. Increased adoption across projects by 40% by designing modular, configurable rule sets for easy integration.

projects.title: RAG Chatbot with Persistent Memory
projects.description: Deployed a production RAG chatbot implementing persistent long-term memory for Dark Alpha Capital. Resolved critical memory persistence issues in multi-session AI workflows, increasing chatbot context retention by 80% and reducing duplicate query errors by over 50%. Improved multi-turn conversation accuracy by 40% and reduced internal deal tracking time by 30%.

projects.title: AI-Powered Soil Moisture Prediction
projects.description: Achieved 96% predictive accuracy in soil moisture estimation at FarmX Inc. through developing an AI-powered pipeline leveraging Random Forest and Gradient Boosting algorithms. Reduced irrigation error variance by 40% through soil-texture-specific calibration models. Implemented Linear Regression achieving competitive accuracy within 5% of ensemble models while reducing training complexity and computation time by 60%.

projects.title: Deal-Sourcing Platform
projects.description: Built scalable full-stack web application using Next.js, Prisma, and PostgreSQL for Dark Alpha Capital. Reduced manual deal tracking efforts by 25% through automated workflows and integrations. Developed comprehensive data management system with real-time updates and analytics.

internship.availability: Available for summer 2026 internships and full-time opportunities after May 2026
internship.workStyle: Fast learner, collaborative team player, and problem solver with proven experience in production systems at FarmX Inc. and Dark Alpha Capital. Strong background in AI/ML, full-stack development, and delivering measurable results.
internship.goals: Join an innovative team working on cutting-edge technology in AI/ML or full-stack development. I want to contribute to meaningful projects while growing my skills in scalable software architecture, machine learning systems, and impactful product development.

funFacts: Achieved 96% accuracy in AI-powered soil moisture prediction at FarmX Inc.
Built production RAG chatbot with 80% improvement in context retention
Reduced code review time by 30% with automated GitHub bot
Mentored 50+ first-year engineering students as Barrett Peer Mentor
Treasurer of SoDA (Software Developer Association) at ASU
Barrett Honors College Scholar with 3.84 GPA
personality.workingStyle: I'm passionate about learning new technologies and tackling challenging problems with scalable, efficient solutions. I thrive in collaborative environments and love building systems that deliver measurable impact.
personality.motivation: Building innovative technology that solves real-world problems through AI/ML, full-stack development, and data-driven solutions
